oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian human head figurine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian ceramic figure depicting a human face with ear plugs and a headdress. Details in the head dress include two arching lines above the face and repeating vertical lines. It is unclear whether or not the curved indentaiton behind the head dress was intentional. The back of the object is completely flat. Eyes and ear plug features are incised.
Irregular breakage below the neck suggest the figure was part of a larger piece. The upper portion of the headdress also appear to be broken.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
